intro: Dicliptera montana, commonly known as the mountain dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a fine pubescence, which helps reduce water loss. Dicliptera montana produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
